content: Select next item to the right

comment.text: This translation key is used for "Select next item to the right", appearing as a button label on a hotkeys panel in the UI. It indicates the action of moving to the next element from the left when a specific hotkey is pressed.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation 'Ընտրեք հաջորդ միավորը ձախ կողմում' translates to 'Select the next item to the left'. The English states 'to the right', which is the opposite direction.
The right parenthesis in the Japanese translation appears unnecessary and disrupts the flow. While it clarifies direction, it’s stylistically awkward for this context.

The translation '오른쪽으로 다음 항목 선택' is a literal translation but doesn't quite capture the intended meaning of 'Select next item to the right' in a user interface context. It sounds a bit formal and not as natural.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural phrasing like '오른쪽 항목 선택' or '다음 항목 오른쪽으로 선택'. The best option depends on the surrounding UI text.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "ເລືອກລາຍການຕໍ່ໄປໄປທາງຂວາ" doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Select next item to the right'. 'ຕໍ່ໄປ' is used twice and is redundant.  It translates to 'Select next item to the right to the right.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເລືອກລາຍການຕໍ່ໄປທາງຂວາ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Выделить следующий объект справа" literally translates to "Select the next object to the right". While not entirely wrong, "Select" is a broader term and "выделить" can imply highlighting or assigning, which isn't always the desired action. For a more accurate translation in a hotkey context, a verb like "Перейти к" (Go to) or "Выбрать" (Choose) might be more appropriate.

The translation 'දකුණු පස ඊළඟ අථකය තෝරන්න' translates literally to 'Select the next item to the right'. While understandable, it's not the most natural phrasing in Sinhala. The phrase 'right' is somewhat ambiguous; it could refer to a physical direction or a sequential order. Since this is a hotkey, it likely refers to the latter.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a phrasing that more clearly indicates selecting the *next* item in a sequence, such as 'ඊළඟ අයිතමය තෝරන්න' (eelaga aimayama thorenna) which translates to 'Select the next item'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Izberi naslednji predmet desno' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Select next item to the right'. 'Predmet' translates to 'item' but can sound overly formal. A more natural phrasing would incorporate the concept of movement or selection within a list/sequence.
While 'element' is accurate, it's important to ensure consistency with other UI elements. If 'predmet' is used elsewhere for 'item', stick with that for consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: N/A - Consistency check needed with existing UI terminology.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Одабери следећу ставку са десне стране" is a bit verbose and doesn't quite capture the conciseness of "Select next item to the right." "Ставку" (item) isn't strictly necessary. A more natural and shorter translation would be better.

The translation 'Odaberi sledeću stavku sa desne strane' is a literal translation and not idiomatic for UI elements. 'Stavka' refers to an item in a list, but in the context of hotkeys, 'item' refers to a command or action. The phrase is also a bit verbose.
While technically correct, 'desne strane' sounds somewhat unnatural in this context. The phrase 'desno' is more commonly used for direction.

The translation 'Sıradaki öğeyi sağa doğru seç' is literal but not the most natural way to express 'Select next item to the right' in Turkish. It sounds a bit clunky. A more idiomatic translation would be preferred.
